newsitem.title: USA: Anheuser Busch to boost stake in Corona brewer.
newsitem.headline: Anheuser Busch to boost stake in Corona brewer.

text.p: Anheuser-Busch Cos. Inc. said Wednesday the brewing giant will pay about $550 million to increase its stake in Mexico's No. 1 brewer, Grupo Modelo S.A. de C.V., to 37 percent.
Grupo Modelo is known in the United States for its Corona brand beer.

In 1993, St. Louis-based Anheuser-Busch acquired a 17.7 percent direct and indirect interest in Grupo Modelo and its subsidiary, Diblo, for $477 million, with options to increase its holdings at any time between mid-1995 and the end of 1997.
The latest investment is expected to close in late January.

As a result of the investment, the number of seats Anheuser-Busch holds on the Modelo board will rise to 10 from the current three. The total number of seats on the Modelo board will increase to 21 from the current 14.
